summary: This is an email exchange between attorneys discussing progress in identifying a woman who allegedly had a relationship with Leon Black, whom he helped start an art gallery. The email includes details about the gallery's corporate registration and contact information for the woman.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: Partner at Wigdor LLP who is investigating and sharing information about a woman allegedly connected to Leon Black, including her contact details and details about an art gallery he helped start.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Mentioned as allegedly having had a relationship with a woman and helping her start an art gallery, which is the subject of the attorney's inquiry.

connections.description: Christensen is investigating allegations involving Leon Black, specifically his alleged relationship with and financial assistance to a woman in starting an art gallery.
Alleged relationship where Leon Black helped the woman start an art gallery, as reported by the attorney's client.

events.title: Art Gallery Company Dissolution
events.description: The limited liability company associated with the art gallery allegedly helped by Leon Black was dissolved.

locations.address: 237 Lafayette Street #6E, New York, New York, 10012
locations.context: Address listed for the initial art gallery entity allegedly helped by Leon Black.
Office address of Wigdor LLP, Jeanne M. Christensen's law firm.

keyFacts: An attorney is investigating allegations that Leon Black had a relationship with a woman and helped her start an art gallery.
The art gallery was registered as a domestic limited liability company in New York at 237 Lafayette Street #6E and was dissolved on September 6, 2018.
The attorney has obtained the woman's correct and working cell phone number as part of the investigation.
The communication is marked as potentially containing confidential or attorney-client privileged information.
